content.title: Internship Scheme Of The Ministry Of Labour & Employment
content.details: Through the Internship Scheme, the Ministry of Labour & Employment engage eligible students as 'Interns' to work for mutual benefit. The 'Interns' shall have an opportunity to know about the Government functioning and Department Policy issues in the Government of India and contribute to the Policy/Legislation formulation by generating policy inputs such as empirical analysis, briefing reports, policy papers, etc.
benefits: Logistic Support including working space and computer with internet facility
Certificate of Internship upon satisfactory completion
eligibility: Pursuing law in the last two years of degree course
Students pursuing Post Graduation in Law
Pursuing MBA / MSW / MSc / MA enrolled in a recognized University/Institution within India or abroad
content.application_process: The application should be submitted in the prescribed proforma. The duly filled-in and self-attested application form should be sent by email to adm1@nic.in by 31st January / 31st July of the respective year.
documents_required: Self-Attested Marksheet / Certificate at the time of acceptance of the offer
Letter from the Supervisor/Head of Department/Principal at the time of joining
No Objection Certificate (NOC) at the time of joining
Submission of paper on the allotted subject at the time of completion

faqs.question: What Documents Are Required To Be Submitted At The Time Of Joining The Internship?
faqs.answer: Letter from the Supervisor/Head of Department/Principal, indicating the status of the applicant in their Institution and No Objection Certificate (NOC).

faqs.question: What Documents Are Required To Be Submitted At The Time Of Completion Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: Submission of a paper on the allotted subject to the Head of the Division a Report / Paper at the end of the internship.

faqs.question: What Documents Are Required To Be Submitted At The Time Of Acceptance Of The Offer For The Internship?
What Is The Amount Of The Monthly Remuneration That Is Paid To The Interns?
faqs.answer: The Interns will be paid a stipend @ ₹ 8,000/- per month.

faqs.question: Will Logistic Support Be Provided By MoLE To The Interns?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Ministry of Labour & Employment shall provide them with working space and computer with internet facility.

faqs.question: When Will The Certificate Of Internship Be Provided To The Interns?
faqs.answer: Certificates will be issued to the interns on satisfactory completion of their internship.

faqs.question: Can The Students Who Are Pursuing Civil Engineering Also Apply To This Scheme?
faqs.answer: No, the student should be pursuing law or related fields.

faqs.question: At What Email ID Should The Application Be Mailed?
faqs.answer: The duly filled-in and self-attested application form should be sent by email to adm1@nic.in.

faqs.question: Where Can I Find The Proforma Of The Application Form?
faqs.answer: The proforma of the Application Form can be found at - https://labour.gov.in/sites/default/files/internship_programme.pdf.

faqs.question: What Is The Value Proposition For The Interns?
faqs.answer: The 'Interns' shall have an opportunity to know about the Government functioning and contribute to the Policy/Legislation formulation.

faqs.question: Where Shall The Interns Be Placed During The Course Of The Internship?
faqs.answer: Placement of Interns will be carried out with the approval of the Secretary (L&E).

faqs.question: How Long Shall Be The Internship?
faqs.answer: The duration of the internship will be from two to six months.
